website_summaries.verdict: A well-made canopy from a company with a good reputation. This canopy lives up to expectations.
pros: Large footprint provides more coverage than most canopies
Eaves give even more shade and help water runoff during rain
cons: Some users found poles do not withstand strong winds

customer_reviews.title: This is the best
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because we go camping a lot. The weather isn’t always agreeable and we would like to spend time outside. We also use it for over our dogs pen when we go camping. To keep the sun off of them. This is so big. 13 x 13. It really gives you a lot of room to move. I think this is the best one we’ve ever owned. If you’re looking for one of these items this is the brand and the one you want to purchase. It is sturdy and very well-made.
customer_reviews.author: Fastbunnie

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable in wind.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased for a beach trip. It was very easy to set up and was nice when conditions were perfect. We left the tent up to go to lunch and when we returned it had collapsed. There was a small thunderstorm that came through very quickly that was the likely cause. The weather service claims that gusts of only 20 to 25 mph were present (Destin, FL on July 13, 2017). This should not be enough wind to collapse the frame of a canopy tent. *Will update when manufacturer addresses the warranty with me.
customer_reviews.author: SarahS

customer_reviews.title: We have had 2; both broke within the first week
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 2 of these. The first one broke on the second use. Coleman was nice enough to replace it. We had the replacement for almost 2 years before using it. That one also broke - in the same location - within our 1 week vacation at the beach. This could be a great canopy- if it lasted. We have a Coleman tent that we live. And kudos to the company for their customer service on replacing our first one, but unfortunately I just can’t recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: GR

customer_reviews.title: Sad!
customer_reviews.text: I have traditionally been a big fan of Coleman but I found this canopy to be very disappointing. The mechanism is very complex with more moving parts than most pop ups and very prone to breaking on set up. My unit broke struts in three places on the third use. I am an engineer and read instructions so I don't think it was operator error. Disposed of and replaced it with another brand. Sad!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E. Atkins

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use.  Unfortunately,a waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this April 2017 from Amazon. Last year we didn't camp but did this year and set this up. Immediately 2 ends of metal support bars for canopy snapped away from the plastic piece that joins the two pieces together. Very disappointed - first time setting it up, it broke and beyond warranty from Amazon and Coleman. It still works but a new product should not break without force. The size, style and canopy are fantastic. The setup is actually very easy and no stress on you or any part of canopy, but obviously it needs little to no stress to snap and break, so be forewarned.
customer_reviews.author: Gil L

customer_reviews.title: Failed twice, both within weeks of setup.
customer_reviews.text: I tried to love this stupid tent...the easy an appearance of it was great...but the first one fail one week after I put it up, reason? One of the clamp pieces broke it could no longer stay up...returned for replacement... unfortunately I waited a bit too long to test the replacement. It's been up a week and the wind relatively mild, ripped the tether point out causing the whole this to fail, bars bent, pieces broke, completely unsalvageable. Cannot recommend it. It's supposed to be an outdoor thing, why is it so fragile? Did I get two duds? Maybe, but I'm not paying to find out.
customer_reviews.author: C is me

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend. Cheaply made, 3 of the support arms snapped just setting it up, which is ridiculous. Because of the broken support arms the canopy wouldn't fold shut, it was stuck partially open. Which means it couldn't be returned. Amazon was NO HELP with refunding or replacing. Super disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: BWK

customer_reviews.title: A very nice canopy BUT
customer_reviews.text: I love this canopy and several people who have seen us use it have gone out and bought one. It provides lots of shade, is very roomy (the 13x13 size makes a bigger difference than you'd think) and we can clip make-shift shade walls along the sides (wish Coleman offered some for this!!!). The wind did in my first canopy but we still bought a second. The canopy itself held up well but the frame bent quickly. I will not put mine up in a stiff wind. The up side is that it's pretty easy to put up and super easy to take down so if the weather turns bad it's quickly packed and in the car.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this one
customer_reviews.text: Canopy is 2 pieces of canvas sewn together. There are 8 Velcro attachments sewn alongside the seam from the 2 pieces of canvas. They are used to attach the canopy to the frame. 5 of the 8 are tearing away from the canvas and leaving gaps between the canopy pieces. The eave portion of the frame requires 4 arms to slide up and out and they are very, very difficult to operate once the frame is erected.
customer_reviews.author: Gary K

customer_reviews.title: No replacement canopy when it tears
customer_reviews.text: Coleman was the brand you wanted when you go camping. It “WAS” the brand. I bought this Coleman 13x13 canopy because It was big end it looked nice And easy to put up when I saw one of my friends at a little league game. I bought one and had it for a year then the canopy tore. Coleman does not have a replacement canopy so you are stuck with a perfectly good frame without a canopy. I used it for camping and back yard. But now I can’t find a new canopy for a perfectly good frame. Come on Coleman make a replacement canopy for this. Other than that it is easy to set up and light weight
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice size and sturdy so I bought another one
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine in May of 2017 here on Amazon. I kept it up 24x7 from May through September and it got a lot of sun and weathered all of the summer storms. Perhaps not the intended use. The canopy faded and got brittle. First time out with it this season some strong winds completely tore the canopy apart. So on the one hand I really only got 5 months out of it. On the other, I wasn't using it as a "portable" canopy. It's a nice size and sturdy so I bought another one. Amazon's price is about $30 higher than some competitors so I didn't buy it from Amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stoltz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Canopy. Second one purchased.
customer_reviews.text: I don't have any complaints with this Canopy. I used it for a 5 day camping trip in the Keys. We experienced light wind, light rain, lots of sun, and plenty of shelter with this canopy. It installed easily and did just as it was supposed to. I bought the same one for my Dad almost a year ago and his has been going strong. No issues whatsoever. I would recommend this canopy to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: PacificaPinch

customer_reviews.title: Great value pop-up tent
customer_reviews.text: At 13'x13', this tent has a larger footprint than the typical 9'x9' or 10'x10' tents. The wheeled carrying bag makes transport easier than other tents. It is slightly more complicated to assemble with the center vent piece and the arms that swing out at the corners, but after you've done it once it is really no big deal. It has lasted us 9 years so far, typically used at football tailgates and the occasional event at home. The part showing the most wear is the carrying bag.
customer_reviews.author: crave

customer_reviews.title: Broke during second use - Warranty replacement still over a month away.
customer_reviews.text: Used two times. Well, used once, it broke when setting up the second time. Contacted Coleman for warranty on the frame, went over a week with no response (other than getting an automated case number). Called Coleman and now am being told that they do not have replacement parts, so will be shipping me a new pop up, but they have none in stock, so it will be at least a month before they have any available. It was really nice the one time I used it, and other friends have same one, so hopefully this was just a bad frame, because a warranty isn't much good if they take forever to replace parts,
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Whoever designed this thing is a genius.
customer_reviews.text: We liked the adjustable legs so that we could select the height we wanted it to be. It is sturdier than we expected and we were really impressed with it. We had a party on a summer day with a breeze of 15-20 mph and it was as stable as if the wind was calm. It was set up where we had the added advantage of tree shade, so I cannot say how it provided shade in the open sun. Additionally, we were able to disassemble it and pack it all into the bag for efficient and easy storage and transport. The title of this review are my husband's word. He is really impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Sneekypete

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money...
customer_reviews.text: Set the canopy up on our deck to offer shade. Within one month one side bracket broke completely. 2nd month 2 more brackets broke. Not worth the money paid. Thought Coleman was supposed to be a dependable brand/product. Very sad and wish could get money back ...
customer_reviews.author: NanaHudie

customer_reviews.title: Received with a dented leg
customer_reviews.text: Great product, man made dent in one of the legs. Box had no signs of a dent. Weather has not been hot so Coleman Instant Pop-Up Canopy Tent was sitting the den from May 4th until today. This is my 3rd Coleman in 8 years. They go up in May and Down in October. Cover is the first to go in about three+ years. Late year wind rips the covers. I will buy this again but will now open all products within a week of arrival. The only way it is opened this much is a lot of hammering.
customer_reviews.author: De2595

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart in less than 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: I had set this up next to my house in the backyard where its gated all the way around and mostly protected from wind and even shaded from a nearby tree. This thing can take almost no wind at all, the metal extension arm that connects to the plastic joint completely snapped apart in two spots, then the entire fabric tore and ripped in less than 1 day. There is now a 10 foot tear on the entire side where rain just pours down now and its just getting worse now the leg wont even stay up. Complete trash do not waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Kept us nice and cool.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on my deck (which I haven't done yet), but took it to a family picnic this summer. It was a 90 degree day with a little breeze. Sitting under the canopy was a pleasure. The breeze kept us cool, and canopy blocked the sun. Everyone wanted to cool off under it. I did find it a little heavy for one person to carry and/or set up, but it is well made and much sturdier than others I have used. Setting up and taking down is best accomplished by two people. Only used it once and had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Townyboy

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous to use. Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Tent didn’t last a week. Went flying down the beach as a whole unit. I even added sandbags and longer metal stakes to ensure the security and safety. Do not buy this product. Coleman used to be a great product for camping and sunshades. This unit lifted with a gust of wind. And thee ropes they provided snapped at 3 corners. Piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Lmc

customer_reviews.title: Great canopy
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that the eaves extend over the support poles. It has been up in our yard since we got it and is holding up very well to the weather. The top section allows air to flow through more easily. The tie down ropes that came with it are not of the same quality as the canopy. 2 of them have already broken. I resolved that by buying some sturdier guy wires. The replacements are bright green so people will see them more easily and hopefully not trip over them.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Anderson

customer_reviews.title: "Permanent cover" for our back patio
customer_reviews.text: Our family lives in a rented house with a back patio that is uncovered. We also have two little ones who are always outside. This canopy is perfect for us! It has an overhang to allow rain to flow off rather than pool and strain the material. It has withstood three major storms with 40mph winds, and has also lasted all summer despite temps in the 100's without cracking or becoming brittle. Because we use a canopy as a "permanent" cover, we wanted something durable and this fits the bill perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate, just buy this one.
customer_reviews.text: After years of replacing canopies every 6 or 8 months I think we've found a winner. Legs on this unit are thicker and sturdier than any other I have used. Better than the EZ Ups and the other big names. Every connection is reinforced and seemingly much stronger and less prone to bending. Top fits snug and does not pool in rain. The 2 piece top is great for windy days. The comfort squeeze adjusters are high quality and very easy to use. The whole package is significantly better than anoy other in this category.This one will very likely be around for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrdan

customer_reviews.title: Great canopy for the price! One year later update.
customer_reviews.text: Great so far. Comes with a nice wheeled carry case. Took two people to set it up but it was a really simple process. I secured it to our patio with concrete anchors and it's pretty darn stable. Had a couple small thunderstorms with 30mph gusts and it's held up fine. For the price it's a great buy IMO. We used this continuously from mid-July 2019 through the end of August 2019. No complaints during this time. Great stability and did exactly what we wanted. Pulled it out of controlled indoor storage to setup today (7/3/2020) and the canopy ripped at one of the velcro straps. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Buck

customer_reviews.title: Prone to breakage.
customer_reviews.text: I’m absolutely appalled by this product. The second time we take it out of the bag it’s got 3 broken joints. Can’t use it anymore. Someone needs to get in touch with me to replace this canopy. If I spend good money on a product I expect it to last. This is outrageous.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor product design
customer_reviews.text: This tent was bought for beach protection . During first assemble the sand got into the leg joints making it very difficult to raise and lock the legs. During second assemble in our backyard two of the leg joints broke! No sand involved. To make things worse the manufacturer when contacted required pictures and detailed information to address the design and failure issue. All this was provided but never addressed by Coleman. I would not recommend buying on Amazon since both Amazon and Coleman ignore issues and just do not respond.
customer_reviews.author: CLO

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.text: Well we purchased this just a little over a year ago and we put it up for the second time ever and it was the hardest thing to put up. The first time it was simple, but not this time. Then trying to take it down it was ridiculously hard and the pole snapped!!! Now, I have a $170.00 dollar piece of trash that I only used once!!! So extremely disappointed!!!!! Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Wolfman

customer_reviews.title: Coleman is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: The canopy did the job for 13 months after which time, a fairly light wind proceeded to tear it to shreds from seam to seam. However, that's when Coleman really stepped up and replaced the canopy 1 month after warranty expires. That was very impressive and unexpected. Great customer service! Here is what l learned about this product. It does a great job providing shade, the FRAME holds up very well but the canopy is not meant for long term exposure to the elements. I probably left it up for too long and the sun and elements caused it to deteriorate. Lesson learned. Put it away after use. Anyway good product, great company.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey C. Pardes

customer_reviews.title: Not for the beach
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work out well at the beach. Sand gets inside lower leg adjustment mechanisms, clogging them up, making it very difficult to operate and set lower legs in position. It is very heavy. Once up on a patio or grass is offers great sun coverage and is good. I like the top venting.
customer_reviews.author: Diane W Torrech

customer_reviews.title: Great tent - huge shade
customer_reviews.text: This is a great canopy. We have used it for baseball games as it is HOT in the summer. It works great to shield about 4-6 chairs...or better yet, we have used it to place over many bleachers and it provides share for 10 or more. I think the vented top really helps with the wind and heat - as it stays very cool inside. (The canopy also has reflective material on the inside to repel the suns rays.) This tent is heavy - and a minimum of two people to put up and like many of these...be careful putting up and down as it can get damaged if you are not careful.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: This will not hold up more than 3 uses.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this more expensive version of a canopy tent because I wanted something that would hold up. I used it 2 days and the third time I use it I have to rig it up because it breaks. I don't understand how something can break with so little use. Now I get to waste my time trying to see if anyone I bought it from will help or if I am just out of the money.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Stone

customer_reviews.title: Colman 13X13 Canopy - Thumbs Up
customer_reviews.text: The Colman 13X13 Canopy is the best one we've ever owned. We have two now, and the older one continues to work well for us. The additional overhang from the posts is a big plus. It is effortless to assemble. It is an ideal two-person setup. However, I have set it up myself with minimal difficulty. It isn't light and not overly heavy, and with the wheels on, it makes it easy to move around. Easily covers two picnic tables with space to spare!
customer_reviews.author: Andysfc

customer_reviews.title: Solid canopy!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy canopy if you tie it down right. Need to stake down the guy lines from the top corners. Bought this as a temporary canopy for our patio. Three months later and it’s still holding strong through a Colorado summer which included strong storms, 100+ heat and a snow storm. Love the look of the eaves compared to other canopies. Overall, would recommend this to anyone in the market for a solid canopy. Will be using it for camping once we get a more permanent canopy over the patio.
customer_reviews.author: Shane7892

customer_reviews.title: Nice backyard canopy
customer_reviews.text: Works well, and perfect size for our patio. The only con is the ease of setup. To be fair, there were some small wind bursts, but that caused the tarp to come off the pegs. So we had to keep reattaching the tarp in order to set up the canopy. The directions were lacking, pretty much said to unbox and set up...uh, yeah, thanks. We finally figured it out, and assume next time will go better, hopefully.
customer_reviews.author: Baby Toes!

customer_reviews.title: Great shade, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Love the dimension! The vented roof makes a big difference and the eaves extend the shade footprint. Directions say 2-person setup. I tried doing it myself and made some progress, but for the last extension, I needed the 2nd person. At 100 degrees today, so glad to have this extra shade! I previewed the rating. It isn't white. The larger part is a cream/taupe with the brown cap and eave ring.
customer_reviews.author: Living in Grace

customer_reviews.title: Poor Fabric and Bad Sewing
customer_reviews.text: Very funny that the issue I have w/this canopy is not listed in the stars section. The fabric and sewing are very flimsy and poor. The tent is less than 2 months old and the fabric has already begun to rip along the seams. Coleman could care less what gets said about this product since they are still marketing it. I can not recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: XKR

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this if you want a good canopy.
customer_reviews.text: This canopy lasted all of 3 days. I bought this for our beach vacation and even though there wasn't any high winds it fell apart in less than 3 days. The metal of the spreading support arms was so thin it just snapped in multiple places. I bought this due to Coleman's reputation but it was just junk.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: This is best of breed for this product by far.
customer_reviews.text: easy set up. extra large shaded area with vented top. Sturdy frame. I highly recommend this product. I have had other canopies in the past and none have been made as well as this product. the price is comparable with cheaper made items, If you have a child that plays sports where you need protection from the sun for hours and wont blow away easily when it is slightly windy, then this is the canopy for you.
customer_reviews.author: Cindi

customer_reviews.title: Never had one of these when I went camping, ...
customer_reviews.text: Never had one of these when I went camping, always did the small things that the wind would take in a second. This thing is bigger than expected. The fact that it is 3' larger than the standard camp based overhead shelter can't be over stated. The additional size made it a no brainer to cook and eat at a a 6' picnic table with gear around the edges that still remained dry in a quick down pour in the mountains. There are heavier 7" metal spikes to put in the legs for additional stability and that is an bonus. Seems well constructed and with some finesse I set it up by myself in about 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Dave J

customer_reviews.title: Great Canopy, not ideal for the beach
customer_reviews.text: Like most Coleman products the canopy is great. Easy set up, great shade, big enough for 9 people to comfortably sit under(not social distancing). I bought this for use at the beach for our vacation and found that sand will collect in the locking mechanism for the legs and cause some issues with the legs not locking in place. Took some time to knock and wash the sand out but got it working again.
customer_reviews.author: Joann

customer_reviews.title: not all the way water resistant
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this canopy! It has a ton of room for plenty of people to sit under. If you're looking to get a side wall for it I would recommend getting an 11ft sidewall. Yes, the canopy is 13x13 but the legs aren't. We have a 10 ft sidewall we can make it work but it's a super tight squeeze. The first time we put it up it had rained. The canopy itself kept us dry but the seams dripped water on us while we sat under it. I recommend spraying the seams with a water resistant spray. Other that those point we really do love this canopy
customer_reviews.author: wendy

customer_reviews.title: Good Popup Shelter.
customer_reviews.text: Great pop-up shelter. Took a little bit to figure out, as the canopy itself is not installed onto the frame. It is recommended to pull the canopy off to put it away. But, the extra eaves increases the shade level. But, I will say some of the sewing on the Velcro point to attach the canopy to the frame and poorly sewn, and one side of on Velcro point was not even sewn. Plan to get a friend to sew them back together. Not very good quality control on sewing. Other than that, I enjoy the shelter.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Ackerman

customer_reviews.title: It’s a sun shade not a rain shelter
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to set up. It’s a sun shade not a rain shelter so yes, it leaks rain drops when it’s raining. Not so much that it is useless in the rain but enough so that guests moved to another shelter during a reunion in the rain. Slightly embarrassing! Then again, how often do you hav gatherings in the rain. That said, I would try another pop up that covers all uses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Broken Canopys
customer_reviews.text: The first one of these I bought broke on the 1st use. The arms on the canopy which tighten the top cover part are made of hollow, thin metal. If you put just a little too much pressure to push them down, they snap. Once this metal piece breaks, the tent is worthless. My replacement snapped after only about 15 uses. I don't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brennan Giuffre

customer_reviews.title: Rainy Day Blues!
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered this tent to replace an old pop up. It is a great package EXCEPT... We set it up prior to taking it camping. It went up easy the top was great in the sun and then a little rain came up.😐 It leaks!😞 It drips at the seams and there are 4 tiny pinholes where rain dripped in as well. Had hoped to be able to utilize it rain or shine. The seams leaking results in the metal frame getting wet as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tinia Clark

customer_reviews.title: Basically it was $35 everytime I used the tent - total crap! I would expect more out of Coleman
customer_reviews.text: I used it 4 times and the top frame broke when folding it up - Coleman's response was: we have no replacemnt parts, and to throw it away and buy a new one (25% off). Basically it was $35 everytime I used the tent - total crap! I would expect more out of Coleman!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C.

customer_reviews.title: Unmovable in the wind.
customer_reviews.text: My last 2 pop ups got destroyed by wind gusts. I had this one up for the first time this weekend & we got some guests of wind along with rain. I watched someone else's tent get flipped over & another flop & wobble, but mine never budged thanks to the top vent & the heavy stakes that come with it. It was easy to set up and is a nice size. It does, however, leak a little at the seams in the rain. I'm sure that can be fixed though by spraying some waterproofing sealant on it.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki N. Francks

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this shelter after watching the video with the ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this shelter after watching the video with the industrial fan blowing on the shelter and showing the shelter stayed in place. This is not true. The shelter lifted off the ground several times during mild wind. We then purchased additional stakes and rope and secured the shelter even more. Regardless, the wind took away the shelter. It landed in a tree and was completely damaged, not returnable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive price, not a good quality item.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this canopy, used it once. The second time I used it, there was a windy day, I had weights on each leg, which were 20 pds each, one gust of wind took the whole canopy and lifted it, and blew about 5 feet away. One of the roof bars broke right in half, so I would say the bars are not that sturdy. The price of this canopy wasn’t cheap so I would expect it to be a better quality product which it wasn’t.
customer_reviews.author: debra oldroyd

customer_reviews.title: I've had this canopy for TEN YEARS!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking at camping accessories and came across this item on Amazon... it told me that I had purchased this in November of 2010! Unbelievable! It's hard to believe, but yet, indeed, we've had it for almost ten years! We've used this everywhere... the beach, the mountains, camping, birthday parties, cookouts, baseball tournaments, etc etc and it still looks like new. If you take the time to read the directions and set it up correctly, it doesn't rip or tear. It is large and requires more than one person to set it up (especially if your are short), but once it's up, if you stake it to the ground properly, it should stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! it give so much shade that we take it to the beach and use it for the entire family! Easy to set up, easy to take down, the vent in the top increases stability! It it durable! We use it every weekend during the summer, every day at the beach and for multiple sporting events and family functions...probably abut 30-45 uses a year!
customer_reviews.author: Fred B.

customer_reviews.title: Way more fragile than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Broke the very first time we tried to set it up. Its so large its too much of a hassle to return - this is just a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Christina H

customer_reviews.title: Thought I was getting good quality from Coleman
customer_reviews.text: Had this product for only 2 weeks before one of the poles broke. Thought I was getting good quality from Coleman, but apparently not. Pole broke from a gust of wind said to be under 20 mph. Very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: jarhead

customer_reviews.title: Nicely constructed.
customer_reviews.text: The enclosure arrived quickly and was sturdier than I expected for the price. It covers a large area with good clearance. I had expected the eaves to be optional and secured only by the tie downs. Instead the eaves are structurally supported by ribs at the corners. I had to modify my installation plans to accommodate that but it is working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great canopy. We are currently in our monsoon season in Tucson and with all the wind my canopy still is standing. There is a small opening of the top that has another cover to it that allows some of the wind to go through which I think is partly why it hasn't just lift it up and flew away. It's over our small pool and there is artificial grass underneath so we are not using the spikes it was only tied down to the actual pool. It's holding up really well and it's a very nice canopy and a great buy. Would very much so recommend this
customer_reviews.author: QueenShopper

customer_reviews.title: Nice features, doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this canopy initially it’s quite large and the eave keeps air moving which is nice. Unfortunately my metal frame snapped after only owning for two years. It was only used on the rare camping trip so maybe 5 times. As a more premium product I definitely expected it to last several years of light use.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Dale

customer_reviews.title: Huge size and easy to put up and take down
customer_reviews.text: It is heavy but I think that helps when the wind blows. Have only put it up/down once so far but had others want to buy it from me and asked me where I bought it. Thankfully the bag has wheels. 4 of us had it put all the way up in under 5 minutes. I took it down by myself, it took longer but it was still easy. I just had to keep walking around to each leg to lower it a bit more until it was all the way down. It also fit back in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works great for our patio
customer_reviews.text: We use this on our concrete patio over over patio furniture when company is here to keep the sun off. My husband and I can put it up or take it down relatively fast. We have taken it to friend's houses when they have invited us for summer parties and putting it on the grass we have never had to stake it down. Might be a difference in high winds, though.
customer_reviews.author: VHM

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold up
customer_reviews.text: I had this canopy for only 2 weeks. We had one mildly windy day and the canopy caught a breeze and 2 of the legs snapped. Then the wind caught the top and bent the rest. It’s now nothing but a piece of modern art for the trashcan. I’ve had other canopies that it withstood more wind and rain after years of use than this one did
customer_reviews.author: T. A. Urban

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy construction
customer_reviews.text: This canopy requires four people, one at each corner, to assemble. We were careful in getting it properly in place but it broke the very first time it was used. Could hardly believe, as we have used our old, smaller canopy for years in the same location and with two people assembling it. This is a waste of money, time, landfill space.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: frame work is great, canopy is a piece of crap and you can't get replacement
customer_reviews.text: No replacement canopy and the thing just shreds after months, I feel this is nothing more than a cheap scam
customer_reviews.author: nana

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to setup w/o 2 people.  Locking Mech is horrible
customer_reviews.text: 1st use on this out of the box was not good. It is difficult at best to setup as I experienced with my 12yr old son camping and would be impossible w/o 2 people. And the locking mechanism's were horrible. I have had 2 EZup's in the past and never had issues like this. Expected a lot more from Coleman....I regret purchasing this model.
customer_reviews.author: Judson J Cole

customer_reviews.title: I love(d) this canopy:
customer_reviews.text: The windstorm and subsequent smoke that came with it ravaged this canopy, just two months after I bought it. Oregon is on fire, a pandemic is ravaging our country, and I'm tired. I wish this had made it. Anywho, this was a solid purchase. I wish I could afford to buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Has been through every type of weather condition.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one, both still in use. My son uses them for a summer track and field club. They have been everywhere and survived ever type of weather. The older model we feel has a better very top section. It just is closer to the bottom section and let’s less dew and rain in. We will continue to buy this brand and model.
customer_reviews.author: Scott B. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: plan on only lasting 1 year no matter the make.
customer_reviews.text: Used one summer in Colorado, bought it where I heard you could get a replacement top for it, don't believe anyone, you'll only find a used one that won't be worth it. All the cheap canopies are made in China, the frames will last years, the Tops wont last more than a year even if you take them off and store them in the winter, I've done this for years buying a new one every other year, what a waste of money. Whatever you buy, whomever you buy it from plan on it only lasting one year, the tops are cheap and won't last, unless you can get a tent maker or canvas shop to duplicate it.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Canopy !
customer_reviews.text: Ok, we have had this Canopy for over a year... I feel that NOW is the time for a True Review. This Canopy is EVERYTHING that is described: Easy Up, Easy Down ~ The wind goes right thru the top flap {it doesn't "Take Off" like other Canopies that we have owned, Great Carrying Case, Larger than other Canopies. I would HIGHLY recommend this Coleman Canopy, you will not be disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sized/quality tent for the value!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is one of the most amazing ones on the market. This is our second one. Not super easy to set up on the front end if you don’t know what you’re doing but well worth the work!! You won’t regret buying this tent! And it’s super durable! Had it in high winds and it didn’t collapse or take off like others around us.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Tilka

customer_reviews.title: It was great, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: If I wrote this review last July, it would of gotten 5 stars and all the praise I could give. It was great, easy to set up, take down, air vented well. We would anchor it in our yard most day. One day there were slightly strong winds, which resulted in to huge tears, rendering it useless garbage afterwards. Replacement is like 90 bucks, better off buying a new one for that price, and get a new frame, since the frame was loosening up pretty good also. Its a nice tent if you pull it down right away when semi strong winds come., and for the price, I guess other canopies for that price are probably no stronger.
customer_reviews.author: TOOCHEES

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Used it 2 times when bought- then storage at home garage for 1 Year and when opened, several plastic things were all broken, calcified. So spent all that Amount of money for 2 times.
customer_reviews.author: nathalie

customer_reviews.title: Only lasts a year or so if left up in sunny spot
customer_reviews.text: Mine purchased April 2017, so it's a little more than a year old, and was taken down 6 months of winter. It's a good product and serves the purpose, but it got a tear recently and the fabric is already so fragile as to make it impossible to sew - stitches just ripped out. Claims to be UV resistant, but the thin fabric is destroyed by the sun in little more than a year.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: 2 crossbars were already snapped as tentwas removed from case. The seam at the top of the case was coming apart. One buckle was missing it’s mate (broken? Fell off when packing at plant?) causing remaking buckle to get tangled in wheels.
customer_reviews.author: c campbell

customer_reviews.title: Would still buy
customer_reviews.text: I love the size and the eaves concept but they are kind of flimsy. We’ve only used ours a few times and one of the pivot points on a corner is broken. We will still be able to use it if we’re careful but it’s only a matter of time before I have to buy a new one
customer_reviews.author: Emily Mortensen

customer_reviews.title: Broken out of the box
customer_reviews.text: As luck would have it I bought this and did not need it right away. When the time finally came that I needed a shade tent I went to set it up for the first time and one of the support pieces for the canopy was broken.
customer_reviews.author: mom

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware !
customer_reviews.text: It was fairly easy to put up and I’m so glad we chose this route for sun protection! The deck d day, it was a bit windier and we were able to set it up, but then the joints broke in two places. It’s now Expensive useless trash.... buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Caryn

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Construction
customer_reviews.text: Love this. No more pinch fingers trying to push those little release buttons. This has a larger red button to unlock the legs. It’s a sturdy frame. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Candy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately we put up two of these up on our family vacation. The very first day we used them, a quick storm came through and both tents bent and collapsed, we had to throw them away. The guy next to us had a $30 tent from Walmart and it held up better then ours..
customer_reviews.author: JRA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for sunny Florida beaches!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a super sized canopy and this one fits the bill perfectly. I had been looking for the right one for some time, and afterI watched a YouTube video on the install, I was sold! You won’t be disappointed...we’ll worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: AFG

customer_reviews.title: Love the design
customer_reviews.text: I love the design of this canopy with the cut out in the middle on top because it allows air to escape, not only keeping you cooler under the shade but we have had several storms with high winds (65 mph) and the most damage it received was pulling up the stakes and moving over a couple of feet instead of collapsing (like our previous canopy that we only had up for 6 days and had 50 mph winds and it twisted and broke because there was too much force from the wind underneath and had nowhere to escape). I also like the extra shade from the extended eaves around the edges. I give it a thumbs up
customer_reviews.author: Jamit

customer_reviews.title: Survived a Hellacious Storm!
customer_reviews.text: First time using this canopy and had the worst storm I have ever camped in come through. High winds and 3” per hour rain. I expected the canopy to be destroyed and blown on top of the truck. Went out after the storm and only one rope was loose. I had put some bigger stakes on the ropes which helped but the amazing thing to me was it never collected water on the top. This is the best canopy I know of. Don’t waste your money on the others.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Trahan

customer_reviews.title: We received lots of compliments on this canopy on how nice of size it is & how far it extended ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband received this for father's day to use at our seasonal camping spot. This past weekend we had a storm pop up during the night so we were unable to take it down. All we could do is sit & watch & pray that the high winds & hail didn't wreck it. The canopy survived. We had each leg staked down & thankfully that afternoon my husband had also used the corner strings & staked them into the ground also. We received lots of compliments on this canopy on how nice of size it is & how far it extended past the posts so when it rained you didn't get dripped on.
customer_reviews.author: Mn Oiler

customer_reviews.title: Setup is a breeze for one person and no problem if two are availble to put it up.
customer_reviews.text: So far after 3 weeks set up we learned that it is a good tent. I added water bags on all four corners to hold it down in of strong winds and because the lines get in the way when passing through. You forget they are there sometimes. It has fades a bit already only after 3 weeks set up here in this low desert community. Over all a great sun blocker, and a 13'x13' area to put sleeping cots to rest on or sleep. I purchased two side walls from Colemen to block out lookers in case we wish to undress, etc.. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Canopy. Larger than most for the same cost.
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing this canopy, I checked several others, their ratings, and was about to purchase a smaller, 10x10 canopy. We were looking for something larger but still lightweight. I really liked the feature at the top that provides some wind relief. After receiving this, we loved it. I put it up easily with my 9-yr old son assisting. Since I typically don't read instructions, I did have to lower it to get both canopies over the supports at the top. Once it was up, it was perfect. I am 6'-2" and barely had to duck under the sides. We had some wind and never had issues with the canopy moving.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good product but NOT waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: This canopy is pretty cool. The "eaves" mechanism is ingenious. One thing I wish they would explicitly state is that it is NOT WATERPROOF. By-in-large it is, however the seams are NOT. I discovered this in the comments after ordering, so I got some seam-sealer and even with the seam-sealer it still drips in a couple of spots where I must have not adequately applied it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C

customer_reviews.title: Not so awesome
customer_reviews.text: Update... loved it at first but after SECOND use, it folded in at 2 different spots. Ridiculous, to spend this amount of money and it breaks on second use.
customer_reviews.author: Tdd629

customer_reviews.title: Ease of assembly
customer_reviews.text: I like it because of the ease of assembly. It’s also very sturdy and looks great. I don’t like it because I was looking for a replacement of the canopy top just in case In the future it needs replacing. I was very surprised that the cost of the replacement canopy top is over $300.00. It’s better for me to buy a new tent than just replace the canopy.
customer_reviews.author: Erlinda Pambid

customer_reviews.title: Great canopy!
customer_reviews.text: We love this canopy. Easy set up with no pinching! A little heavy but understandable since it is 13 x 13. Plan on buying a second one for when we camp on I double site.
customer_reviews.author: kimberli davis

customer_reviews.title: Good shade volume but high maintenance
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up and light weight. Made a little flimsy and legs get dirty easily then have problems lock legs in place. Have to keep legs free of dirt and sand. Light weight lots of room for shade. Would be great if only use on grass.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Baham

customer_reviews.title: It’s big! “That’s what she said”
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality material. Used it for camping on a stormy nite with 2 tables and 14 people. Surprise that the constant rain did not destroy it. Took a the weight of the water. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: New13

customer_reviews.title: Pennysylvania Campers
customer_reviews.text: This was very very easy to set up. Was nice and spacious. Good quality. Very well made. The only thing we were disappointed about was that it is not water proof. We had a rain through the night while camping and everything under our new canopy was soaked the next morning. But as a sun shade it is great and we would recommend it highly for that purpose. We are thinking we may spray it with camp dry to help keep things dry when it rains.
customer_reviews.author: Karen from PA

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, love it
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, love it! Seems to be made of sturdier materials than regular pop-up canopies. Well worth the extra $30 than the regular setup's. + extra area coverage is nice too Bought mine as a "blemished item" for half the price... absolutely nothing wrong with it, just a damaged outer packaging. Thanks Amazon ;)
customer_reviews.author: Yevgeniy Kuzmin

customer_reviews.title: Great for a big family
customer_reviews.text: Huge! It is heavy.Once you put it up the first time easier the second. Used it in 106 degree temp and you can actually feel it much cooler under its shade. It adjusts in height. Used it in windy beach weather and it stays out.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Large shelter is nice looking and sturdy- Great Canopy for under 100 bucks!
customer_reviews.text: This canopy set up very quickly and provided much-needed shade for a large group of 10 at the beach this summer. It looks very nice and seems to hold up well with moderate ocean breezes. Great canopy for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Polly

customer_reviews.title: got this on sale - works great and the extended size is useful
customer_reviews.text: got this on sale - works great and the extended size is useful... the extension does make it more difficult to tie to a wall or something because the posts will not sit flush with the edge of the tent due to its size - frame is 10x10 and the tent is 13x13
customer_reviews.author: Nick R.

customer_reviews.title: BE WARNED
customer_reviews.text: Be warned! Great product until something breaks. They DO NOT have parts for it. I couldn't buy the canopy as mine ripped. They said, sorry, but those aren't available.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Nasto

customer_reviews.title: Quality construction; excellent buy.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased many instant canopies and this one is by far the best for the price. Well made; excellent mechanisms; strong arms and joints; dual stakes (poles and guy wires); strong guy wire connections; triple height adjustment; top vent. Easy up and down. Repels water. The eaves are a nice addition. Not the quality construction expected at this price point. Very pleased. And Amazon ddelivered in one day!
customer_reviews.author: Jan Kenney

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: This canopy/tent is just like all others, great till it breaks! We only got 3 uses and it is trash bound. Save $$ and buy cheep ones that can be purchased in bulk for the same price or a little more and just toss them as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Willr

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: The canopy is great love the overhang. If necessary 1 person can assemble. You have to make sure the 4 corners are in the corner pocket and pushed ip before the canopy will go up and lock. Great in some light wind . The frame is heavy duty and not cheap. Best canopy i ever owned and i use it every week
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Pogue

customer_reviews.title: COLEMAN 13 x 13 Instant Eaved Shelter
customer_reviews.text: The fabric part of the canopy has not held up after only one season of use! Canopy has been used according to product specifications, as a sun shelter. Unfortunately, I am extremely disappointed with the quality of this product. It has not been left up during heavy rain, wind, or other inclement weather conditions, nor has the canopy been left up for an extended period of time. The frame remains intact however the fabric is already torn and excessively worn after one summer of careful use as a sun shelter. I would expect a better product from Coleman and would like to be provided with more information on the 1 year limited warranty that Coleman claims to offer.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne OBrien

customer_reviews.title: Great canopy!
customer_reviews.text: The initial set up is a little tricky because you have to get the cover over the frame and the top cover on before you fully open and extend everything. Once the cover is on though, set up and take down are a breeze. It covers a lot of ground, is stable, and tall enough that even our tall friends had head room.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Lamoreaux

customer_reviews.title: Goes up easy enough, heavy but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Really like the amount of shade this thing provides and the ease of setup. It's like anything, try to keep the sand out of the legs and joints. It is pretty heavy, but we had it at the beach for a week and determined that it can be carried out there and set up by one person.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Foster

product_meta.title: Coleman Canopy Tent | 13 x 13 Sun Shelter with Instant Setup, Khaki
product_meta.description:
The Coleman Instant Pop-Up Canopy Tent and Sun Shelter, 13 x 13 Feet, assembles in 3 minutes in 3 easy steps to create a shady area outdoors. This canopy cover is made with UV Guard material that offers protection from the sun’s harmful rays and features 2-way roof vents to keep the air circulating when the temperature rises. The lightweight preattached telescoping poles can be assembled without having to reach over your head, so anyone can set up the tent easily, while comfort grips lock the shelter into place with pinch-free adjustability. Once the canopy tent is assembled, it offers stable shelter on grass, concrete, and asphalt thanks to its welded steel feet. When it’s time to pack up, this shelter can be stored and transported in the included easy-pull wheeled carry bag, which fits inside most cars.

AMAZON.COM
The Coleman 13-by-13-foot Back Home Instant Shelter provides an easy, convenient shelter in the backyard, at a campsite, sporting event, or wherever you need reliable cover from the sun. The Shelter's sturdy, one-piece steel frame sets up quickly and easily in only three minutes, with Coleman's exclusive push-button release levers so your fingers stay safe during setup and takedown. The heavy-duty shelter canopy gives you an instant hex-shaped shelter with a generous center height of eight feet, four inches and also features SPF 50+ UV Guard protection from the sun's rays. 

 Features:


 * Sets up in less than 3 minutes 
 * Heavy-duty 150D canopy with 50+ UV Guard sun protection 
 * Sturdy 28mm one-piece steel frame 
 * Exclusive push-button release levers take it easy on fingers 
 * Hexagon shape for a distinct shelter 
 * Wheeled carry bag 
 * Footed poles for easy securing and stabilization with steel tent pegs 

 Specifications:


 * Shaded Area: 13 by 13 feet 
 * Footprint: 10 by 10 feet 

 About Coleman
More than 100 years ago, a young man with an entrepreneurial spirit and a better idea began manufacturing lanterns in Wichita, Kansas. His name was W.C. Coleman, and the company he founded would change life in America. A man plagued with such poor vision he sometimes had to ask classmates to read aloud to him, Coleman saw a brilliant light in 1900 in a drugstore window that stopped him in his tracks. He inquired about the light inside and discovered he was able to read even the small print on a medicine bottle by the illumination. The lamps had mantles, not wicks, and were fueled by gasoline under pressure instead of coal oil. Soon afterward, Coleman started a lighting service that offered a "no light, no pay" clause--a big step forward for merchants who were burned by inferior products that rarely worked--and drew substantial interest from businesses that wanted to keep their lights on after dark. In the ensuing years, Coleman expanded its product line well beyond lanterns. The company's current catalog is thick with products that make spending time outdoors a pleasure. There are coolers that keep food and drinks cold for days on end, comfortable airbeds that won't deflate during the night, a complete line of LED lights that last for years, powerful portable grills that cook with an authentic open-grill flame, and much, much more. Coleman has truly fashioned much of our outdoor camping experience, and expects to do so for generations to come.
feature_bullets: SUN PROTECTION: UVGuard material offers UPF 50+ sun protection
INSTANT SETUP: In as fast as 3 minutes
COMFORT GRIP: Locks shelter into place for pinch-free pole extending.Rugged, Polyguard 2X double-thick fabric stands up to the rigors of the outdoors
OVERHANGING EAVES: For more shade area with a smaller footprint
1-PIECE FRAME: Folds down for compact storage
DIMENSIONS: 13 x 13 ft. canopy for 169 sq. ft. of shade; 9 ft. 7 in. center height

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
